tit.cmt: 大江 貞奥→OE no Sadaoku (読み方不明)

sen.j: 大江 貞奥（生年不詳-建武 (日本)元年（1334年））は、伝承によると因幡守大江広元の末孫。
sen.e: Sadaoku OE (year of birth unknown - 1334) was believed to be a distant descendant of OE no Hiromoto, who was an Inaba no kami (Governor of Inaba Province).

sen.j: 1332年、後醍醐天皇が隠岐国に流されたとき、供奉の公卿16人が出雲大社より諸国へ配流された。
sen.e: When Emperor Godaigo was deported to Oki Province in 1332, 16 accompanying kugyo (court nobles) were deported to various districts from Izumo-Taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 中納言大江貞奥は同国岐礼庄（現在の岐阜県揖斐川町）に流された。
sen.e: Chunagon (Vice Councilor of State) OE no Sadaoku was deported to Kire-Sho in Mino Province (currently Ibigawa-Cho in Gifu Prefecture), lived in Shiratani in Kire-Sho, and died in the first year of the Kenmu era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chunagon (Vice Councilor of State) OE no Sadaoku was deported to Kire-Sho in Mino Province (present day Ibigawa-Cho in Gifu Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 現在をcurrentlyからpresent dayに変えました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chunagon (Vice Councilor of State) OE no Sadaoku was deported to Kire-Sho in Mino Province (present day Ibigawa-Cho in Gifu Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同地白谷に居住、建武元年に死去した。
sen.e: He lived in Shiratani in Kire-Sho, and died in the first year of the Kenmu era.

sen.j: 同年、貞奥卿を祭神とする白倉神社が建立された。
sen.e: In the same year, the Shirakura-jinja Shrine was established to enshrine Sadaoku.
In the same year, the Shirakura-jinja Shrine was established to enshrine Sadaoku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 美濃明細記に「大野郡岐礼村白倉神社山本中納言藤原貞奥霊神後醍醐天皇奉移隠岐国時岐礼配流建武元年薨山本判官貞元称桜待中納言子孫美濃有称山本云々」とある。
sen.e: The Mino Meisaiki (a document concerning the topography of Mino) says "大野郡岐礼村白倉神社山本中納言藤原貞奥霊神後醍醐天皇奉移隠岐国時岐礼配流建武元年薨山本判官貞元称桜待中納言子孫美濃有称山本云々."
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: The Mino Meisaiki (a document concerning the topography of Mino) says "Ever since the Sirakura shrine (which resembles the resentment of Yamamoto Chunagon Fujiwara Teioku when the Emperor Godaigo was exiled to Oki country) was built in the first year of Kenmu era and after the death of his child, Yamamoto Hougan Jogen Syosaitai Chunagon, their descendants in Mino country began calling themselves as a honorable name of "Yamamoto". "
sen.cmt: この訳については私の独断と偏見で英訳されています。
sen.e: The Mino Meisaiki (a document concerning the topography of Mino) says "大野郡岐礼村白倉神社山本中納言藤原貞奥霊神後醍醐天皇奉移隠岐国時岐礼配流建武元年薨山本判官貞元称桜待中納言子孫美濃有称山本云々."
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できずチェッカーのコメントにより、翻訳者の訳に戻します。

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇は隠岐島より脱出後、流人16人を召し返され嫡男判官貞元が参勤した。
sen.e: After Emperor Godaigo escaped from Oki no Shima Island, the 16 exiled kugyo were called back, and Sadamoto, Sadaoku's legitimate son who was a hangan (judge), joined in place of his father.
Later, Emperor Godaigo escaped from Oki no Shima Island, and called the 16 exiled kugyo back into service; Sadamoto, Sadaoku's heir who was a hangan (judge), joined in place of his father.
sen.cmt: later, ではないと脱出が貞奥の死後だということが伝わりません。あと legitimate son より heir がいいかと思います。
sen.e: Later, Emperor Godaigo escaped from Oki no Shima Island, and called the 16 exiled kugyo back into service; Sadamoto, Sadaoku's heir who was a hangan (judge), joined in place of his father.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 八代元右衛門貞時、足利義満の命を受け数度の合戦にて功を立て、革手合戦の恩賞により岐礼庄六百貫を賜った。
sen.e: Following the orders of Sadatoki YATSUSHIROEMON and Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the legitimate son Sadamoto took active roles in battles, received 600 kan of Kire-Sho as a reward grant, and renovated Shirakura Myojin into Shirakura Taisha (great shrine) in 1403.
sen.cmt: 八代元右衛門貞時→Sadatoki YATSUSHIROEMON (読み方不明); 「八代元右衛門貞時や足利義満の命を受けた嫡男貞元が・・・」という意味ではないかと推測し訳出しました。
sen.e: Under orders from Sadatoki YATSUSHIROEMON and Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, Sadamoto showed valor in many battlefields. In 1403, he renovated Shirakura Myojin into Shirakura Taisha (great shrine).
sen.cmt: このほうが自然です。Legitimate son とは書いてません。あと文が長いため、分割。
sen.e: Under orders from Sadatoki YATSUSHIROEMON and Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, Sadamoto showed valor in many battlefields.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 応永10年（1403）白倉明神を大社に再建した。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1403, he renovated Shirakura Myojin into Shirakura Taisha (great shrine).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 武田信玄の軍師山本勘助は、貞奥より11代末孫で美濃守土岐頼芸の近習であった山本数馬貞正の弟。
sen.e: Kansuke YAMAMOTO, a strategist who served Shingen TAKEDA, was a younger brother of Sadamasa YAMAMOTOKAZUMA who was 11 generations removed from Sadaoku and was an attendant of Mino no kami (Governor of Mino Province) Yorinari TOKI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処; 山本数馬貞正→Sadamasa YAMAMOTOKAZUMA(読み方不明)
sen.e: Kansuke YAMAMOTO, a strategist who served Shingen TAKEDA, was the younger brother of Sadamasa YAMAMOTOKAZUMA, the 11th generation descendant of Sadaoku and was an attendant of Mino no kami (Governor of Mino Province),Yorinari TOKI.
sen.cmt: この方が自然です。あとＣＯＭＭＡを最後のほうに足しました。
sen.e: Kansuke YAMAMOTO, a strategist who served Shingen TAKEDA, was the younger brother of Sadamasa YAMAMOTOKAZUMA, the 11th generation descendant of Sadaoku and was an attendant of Mino no kami (Governor of Mino Province),Yorinari TOKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一時川牛の城主不破河内守の養子となった山本小次郎貞光の子であるとの伝承がある。
sen.e: He is also said to be a child of Sadamitsu YAMAMOTOKOJIRO, who was temporarily an adopted son of Kawachinokami FUWA, the lord of Kawaushi-jo Castle.

sen.j: 写真家の山本悍右は、この山本家の貞奥より本家25代目である。
sen.e: A photographer Kansuke YAMAMOTO is the 25th generation of the honke (head family) from Sadaoku.

sen.cmt: A ではなくThe です。Honkeをfamily descended from.... と訳しました。
